body.p:
Greenup County Court
Special Term September 23d 1862

The affiant Jno. C Adams. States that Some time this afternoon a rule issued was Served on him of at his residence by the Sheriff and during the time he was at his office preparing a response to the Same the Sheriff Served another one on him both Emanating from this Court and before he had time to respond to the last rule and in a Short time after it was Served on him the Sheriff Executed an attachment on affiant requiring him to give bail in the Sum of One hundred Dollars for his appearance before the County Court at 10 Oclock A M September 24th/62 the rules and attachment or order of arrest were all issued from the County Court at a Called term and served on affiant during the afternoon the rules do not inform affiant upon whose motion they were made The affiant States that the Judge of the County Court. Judge John Seaton is his bitter Enemy as he really believes and is as he believes. is wholly incompetent from want of legal Knowledge as well as his prejudice lately manifested against affiant to try these rules and &c against affiant he does not believe he can have a fair trial before him because of his prejudice &C and he therefore prays that this cause upon the various rules and motions attachments and orders of arrest be continued until the regular term of the Greenup County Court at which time he can procure a change of venue by the Circuit Judge of this Judicial District in conformity to law. he does not make this motion for a change
of venue upon this affidavit for delay or vexation but Simply that he may have a fair and impartial hearing in response to the rules and attachments that have been awarded against him and unless he can procure a continueance for a change of venue he verily believes that great and manifest injustice will be done him
Affirmed to before me by John C Adams, Sept. 24 1862
John S. Jones. Clk Greenup County Court

A copy Attest
John S. Jones. C G.C C.

Commonwealth
vs.
John. C. Adams
Affidavit Deft
Filed Sept. 24 1862
